content:
Adding relevant skills to your profile can help you appear in search results for those skills, and it can also give your connections an idea of your expertise. Data visualization and statistical analysis are great skills to add, especially since they're related to your new certification.

**Adding skills to your profile:**

1. Go to your LinkedIn profile and click on the "Skills & Endorsements" section.
2. Click on the "Add a new skill" button.
3. Type in the skill you want to add (e.g., "Data Visualization" or "Statistical Analysis").
4. Select the skill from the dropdown list or create a new one if it's not already listed.
5. Repeat the process for each skill you want to add.

**Getting endorsements from connections:**

Endorsements are a way for your connections to validate your skills and expertise. Here's how to get endorsements:

1. Make sure you've added the skills you want to be endorsed for (as mentioned above).
2. Your connections can endorse you for those skills by visiting your profile and clicking on the "Skills & Endorsements" section.
3. They'll see a list of your skills and can click the "+" icon next to each skill to endorse you.
4. You can also request endorsements from specific connections by sending them a message or commenting on one of their posts, asking them to endorse you for a particular skill.

Tips:

* Only ask connections who are familiar with your work or expertise to endorse you.
* Endorsements from connections who are also experienced in the same skill carry more weight.
* You can also endorse your connections' skills in return, which can help build your professional network and relationships.

By adding relevant skills and getting endorsements, you'll be able to showcase your expertise and build credibility on LinkedIn.
